Basic usage of tekkamaki

Source: vignettes/tekkamaki.Rmd
tekkamaki.Rmd

Run simulation:

library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(tekkamaki)

result = tekka('--seed=42 -y100 -l5') %>% print()
#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>   sample_family        demography          
#>   <list>               <list>              
#> 1 <tibble [3,867 × 6]> <tibble [7,488 × 5]>

A result is a nested tibble with two columns: sample_family and demography:

sample_family = result$sample_family[[1L]] %>% print()
#> # A tibble: 3,867 x 6
#>    id    father_id mother_id birth_year location capture_year
#>    <chr> <chr>     <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>        <int>
#>  1 208   0         0                  0        1           NA
#>  2 209   0         0                  0        1           NA
#>  3 207   208       209                8        0           NA
#>  4 211   0         0                  0        1           NA
#>  5 212   0         0                  0        1           NA
#>  6 210   211       212                7        1           NA
#>  7 206   207       210               13        1           NA
#>  8 218   0         0                  0        1           NA
#>  9 219   0         0                  0        1           NA
#> 10 217   218       219               14        1           NA
#> # … with 3,857 more rows
demography = result$demography[[1L]] %>% print()
#> # A tibble: 7,488 x 5
#>     year season location   age count
#>    <dbl>  <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1     0      0        0     0  1000
#>  2     4      0        0     4   821
#>  3     4      1        0     4   759
#>  4     4      2        0     4   708
#>  5     4      3        0     4   635
#>  6     5      0        0     0  6267
#>  7     5      0        0     5   517
#>  8     5      1        0     0  3987
#>  9     5      1        0     5   473
#> 10     5      2        0     0  2481
#> # … with 7,478 more rows

Here is an example of visualizing demography:

library(ggplot2)
df = demography %>%
  dplyr::mutate(time = year + 0.25 * season) %>%
  dplyr::group_by(time, location, age = ifelse(age > 4, "adult", "juvenile")) %>%
  dplyr::summarise(count = sum(count))

ggplot(df, aes(time, count)) +
  geom_path(aes(colour = age, group = age)) +
  facet_grid(location ~ .) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(legend.position = "top")
